newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Serbian police break coffee smuggling route - paper.
newsitem.headline: Serbian police break coffee smuggling route - paper.

text.p: Serbia's police force has cut off a coffee smuggling route from Hungary to Yugoslavia at the Kelebija border crossing, Belgrade daily Politika quoted the Serbian Interior Ministry as saying Wednesday.
Some 500,000 kilos of coffee were brought into Yugoslavia without payment of customs duties over a period of time through a private firm and were later sold on the black market, the ministry said.
This cost the state some 9.5 million dinars ($1.7 million) in customs duties, it said.
The police seized two trailer trucks with 50 tonnes of coffee on May 24 and arrested 11 persons involved in the smuggling, including five customs officers and two policemen.
Earlier this month the head of the Yugoslav customs Mihalj Kertes announced a clampdown on all forms of illegal imports. --Beti Bilandzic, Belgrade newsroom +381 11 222 4305
